1.long: a brother, member of the same religious community, especially a fellow-Christian.

1.brief: I take before, anticipate, am overtaken
1.long: I take before, anticipate; pass: I am caught or overtaken, taken by surprise.

1.brief: a man, one of the human race
1.long: a man, one of the human race.
any one, some one, a certain one or thing.
a falling away, lapse, slip, false step, trespass, sin.

(a) I fit (join) together; met: I compact together, (b) act. and mid: I prepare, perfect, for his (its) full destination or use, bring into its proper condition (whether for the first time, or after a lapse).
I look at, regard attentively, take heed, beware, consider.

2.long: a weight, burden, lit. or met.
(a) I carry, bear, (b) I carry (take) away.

2.brief: I fill up, make up, fulfill
2.long: I fill up, make up, complete the measure of, fulfill, carry out the commands (provisions, etc.) of.

usage, custom, law; in NT: of law in general, plur: of divine laws; of a force or influence impelling to action; of the Mosaic law; meton: of the books which contain the law, the Pentateuch, the Old Testament scriptures in general.

3.brief: I think, seem, appear, it seems
3.long: I think, seem, appear, it seems.
any one, some one, a certain one or thing.

4.brief: but, on the other hand, and

work, task, employment; a deed, action; that which is wrought or made, a work.

4.long: I put to the test, prove, examine; I distinguish by testing, approve after testing; I am fit.
each (of more than two), every one.

a boasting; a ground of boasting (glorying, exultation).
into, in, unto, to, upon, towards, for, among.

one's own, belonging to one, private, personal; one's own people, one's own family, home, property.
a burden; the freight of a ship.

6.brief: I share, communicate, have fellowship with
6.long: (a) I share, communicate, contribute, impart, (b) I share in, have a share of, have fellowship with.

6.brief: but, on the other hand, and
6.long: a weak adversative particle, generally placed second in its clause; but, on the other hand, and.

6.long: a word, speech, divine utterance, analogy.

6.long: all, the whole, every kind of.
intrinsically good, good in nature, good whether it be seen to be so or not, the widest and most colorless of all words with this meaning.

7.long: I lead astray, deceive, cause to wander.

into, in, unto, to, upon, towards, for, among.

life, both of physical (present) and of spiritual (particularly future) existence.
age-long, and therefore: practically eternal, unending; partaking of the character of that which lasts for an age, as contrasted with that which is brief and fleeting.

9.brief: but, on the other hand, and
9.long: a weak adversative particle, generally placed second in its clause; but, on the other hand, and.

one's own, belonging to one, private, personal; one's own people, one's own family, home, property.

9.brief: I am unstrung, become weak, fail
9.long: I loose, release, unloose (as a bow-string), relax, enfeeble; pass: I am faint, grow weary.

10.long: as, like as, about, as it were, according as, how, when, while, as soon as, so that.

12.long: I look well, make a fair show (a good outward appearance, and so win good opinion).

18.brief: verily, truly, amen, so let it be
18.long: verily, truly, amen; at the end of sentences may be paraphrased by: So let it be.
